Posts.Content: Greetings. Newly diagnosed, details below. As I follow in all of your footsteps, doing as much online research as humanly possible to determine which treatments to consider, I'd pose the following question: In Dr. Walsh's book, he advocates for a biopsy second opinion. Has anyone requested and benefited from having their results reviewed by a another pathologist? Thanks in advance for any help. {Congrats on a terrific and useful Forum}
Posts.Signature: PCa Dx Sept. 2016, age 58. Biopsy right side, 3+3, two of eight cores, one core = 2MM, less than 5%. Biopsy left side, 3+4, five of eleven cores, one core = 8MM, 60%. PNI seen on both sides. No lymph perm seen. PSA- 11/12 = 3.52, 6/16 = 6.43, 7/16 =8.08 8/16 = 5.2 (15%free).
Posts.Title: Merits of biopsy second opinion

Posts.Content: Thanks guys. Is there a thread I can reference for referrals/recommendations.? Finding docs with experience in their field is homework well worth doing, but first hand experience can be valuable too.
Posts.Title: Merits of biopsy second opinion

Posts.Content: The surgeon I'm seeing Friday has requested the biopsy slides, so I guess I'll get my second opinion after all. I still may enlist Dr. Epstein due to his reputation [ and because I just know he is going to say: "Steve, there has been a terrible mistake. Not only is there no cancer but me and my colleagues wish to congratulate you on the worlds most beautiful prostate gland".] The list of questions for the surgeon in Pittsburgh is so long I almost feel sorry for him. After that, because of my location, I thought it would be worthwhile to visit a doc at the Cleveland Clinic. Their list of experts is impressive. So much so I'm having a hard time selecting one.
Posts.Signature: PCa Dx Sept. 2016, age 58. Biopsy right side, 3+3, two of eight cores, one core = 2MM, less than 5%. Biopsy left side, 3+4, five of eleven cores, one core = 8MM, 60%. PNI seen on both sides. No lymph perm seen. PSA- 11/12 = 3.52, 6/16 = 6.43, 7/16 =8.08 8/16 = 5.2 (15%free).

Posts.Content: For those who chose SBRT, or those who researched that treatment option, could I please get input on qualified/experienced doctors and hospitals who perform it. FWIW, I live in the north east part of the country, but travel is not a concern. Thanks in advance.

Posts.Title: For those who chose SBRT
